structure.unit: Executive And Administrative Officers Of The Commonwealth

law.catch_line: Board Of Registration Of Hearing Instrument Specialists; Evaluation Of Performance
law.text: Beginning January 1, 1999 and every three years thereafter, the state auditor shall conduct a performance review in accordance with generally accepted government auditing standards in cooperation with the division, the board and appropriate consumer and governmental agencies to evaluate the performance of the board and the consumer protection provided by the statute and regulations, and shall submit a written report to the house and senate post audit and oversight committees, to the clerks of the house of representatives and the senate and to the chairs of the legislatureâ€™s joint committee on health care detailing whether the services provided by the board are providing consumer protection and adequately meeting consumer needs.
